com.sri.ai.grinder.sgdpllt.api

Interface Context

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>, Constraint, Expression, Registry, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CompleteMultiVariableContext, MultiVariableContextWithCheckedProperty, TrueContext

    @Beta
public interface Context
extends Registry, Constraint
    A Context combines a Registry and a Constraint in order to provide a context for SGDPLL(T)-related methods.
    Author:
    braz

    • Method Summary

      Returns an SGDPLLTTester representing the conjunction of this constraint and a given formula, or null if they are contradictory.
      default Context conjoinWithConjunctiveClause(Expression conjunctiveClause, Context context)
      Returns the result of conjoining this constraint with all literal conjuncts of a given conjunctive clause (note that if conjunction is not an application of and, it will be considered a unit conjunction with itself the only conjunct.

      • conjoin

        default Context conjoin(Expression formula,
                        Context context)
        Description copied from interface: Constraint
        Returns an SGDPLLTTester representing the conjunction of this constraint and a given formula, or null if they are contradictory.

        At this point, the formula should be either a literal, or a Constraint.

        Extensions may want to override this method if there are more efficient ways of conjoining with (certain types of) constraints than simply treating them as a formula

        Specified by:
        conjoin in interface Constraint
        Parameters:
        formula - the formula to be conjoined.
        context - the context
        Returns:
        the application result or null if contradiction.

      • conjoin

        default Context conjoin(Expression formula)

      • extendWith

        default com.sri.ai.util.base.Triple<Context,ExtensionalIndexExpressionsSet,Expression> extendWith(ExtensionalIndexExpressionsSet indexExpressions,
                                                                                                  Expression expressionInScope)
        Extends context with index expressions, taking into account that new contextual variables may collide with existing ones. In this case, it renames the incoming variables to unique identifiers and replaces them in the types of remaining index expressions. It also renames these indices if they occur in a given expression -- this is useful because the client code (invoking this method) often knows that these renamed indices may occur in a known set of expressions that need to be updated accordingly. Returns the new context, the index expressions and expression in scope after the renaming.
        Parameters:
        indexExpressions -
        expressionInScope -
        Returns:
        the new context and the index expressions and expression in scope after the renaming
